subject: Psychology
title: The Status Quo Bias
description: A fast breakdown of The Status Quo Bias for builders.

hook.text: You've used the same phone plan for years. A cheaper one exists. You just never switch.

buildup.text: Status quo bias is the preference for the current state of affairs â€” change feels risky, even when it's not.

discovery.text: Default options are powerful. Organ donation rates are 90% in opt-out countries and 15% in opt-in ones.

twist.text: Status quo bias combines loss aversion and inertia. Changing means risking loss, so doing nothing wins.

climax.text: Whoever designs the default option wields enormous power, because most people simply never change it.

punchline.text: The default wins because change feels like loss.

quiz.question: Why does the status quo bias make defaults so powerful?
options: People rarely switch from the default option
Defaults are always the best option
